etymology.description: 牀(牀) (chuáng, "bed") composed of 爿(牀) (qiáng, "half of a tree trunk") + 木(木) (mù, "tree") = tree trunk used for support -> bed or wooden bed frame
etymology.interpretation: 牀(牀) (chuáng, "bed") is a phono-semantic compound where 爿(牀) (qiáng, "half of a tree trunk") provides the phonetic element, and 木(木) (mù, "tree") gives the semantic component, representing its construction from wood.
etymology.simplification: 床(床) incorporates 广(广) (guǎng, "house") indicating its placement inside, making 日(日) (rì, "sun") unnecessary.

examples.chinese: 这张牀(牀)很舒适(很舒適)。
晚上睡觉时(晚上睡覺時)，我躺在牀上休息(我躺在牀上休息)。
examples.pinyin: Wǎnshàng shuìjiào shí, wǒ tǎng zài chuáng shàng xiūxí.
examples.english: When it is time to sleep at night, I lie on the bed to rest.
